1/(nπ) > 0.0001 ⇒ n < 10000/π ≈ 3183.098  
1/(nπ) < 0.001 ⇒ n > 1000/π ≈ 318.309  

Thus, n ranges from 319 to 3182, inclusive. The number of integers is:

3182 - 319 + 1 = 2864

The function y = sin(1/x) has x-intercepts where sin(1/x) = 0, which occurs when 1/x = nπ for integer n. Thus, x = 1/(nπ). We need x in (0.0001, 0.001), so:

0.0001 < 1/(nπ) < 0.001  
=> 1000 < nπ < 10000  
=> 1000/π < n < 10000/π  
≈ 318.31 < n < 3183.098

Thus, n ranges from 319 to 3182, inclusive. The number of integers is 3182 - 319 + 1 = 2864.

$\boxed{2864}$
